intro: Omphalea ankaranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar moonseed, is a climbing shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, spiny fruits. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
